intro: Sida beddomei, commonly known as the beddome sida, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its small, white to pale purple flowers are clustered in axillary inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Sida beddomei is often found in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gravelly soils.
